did.unittitle: Charles C. G. Chaplin stamp collection

bioghist.p: Charles C.G. Chaplin (d. 1991) was a research associate in the Department of Ichthology and a Trustee of the Academy of Natural Sciences. He and his wife Louise endowed the Chaplin Chair of Ichthology in 1959. He participated in several of the Academy's collecting expeditions to Florida, the Caribbean, and South America. With James E. Bohlke, he coauthored Fishes of the Bahamas and Adjacent Tropical Waters, 1968.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of nine volumes of stamps (1959-1981), arranged by subject, then grouped by series. Fish are well represented in the collection. Other subjects include birds, shells, crustaceans, lizards, snakes, turtles, mammals, and butterflies. One of the albums is a set of songbird stamps issued by the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds in 1981. The collection also includes a series of stamps issued by Australia featuring fish collected by an Academy expedition to the Indian Ocean in 1979 and photographs and negatives of fish from the Cocos (Keeling) Islands.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
